entities.name: harry
entities.description: The main character of the story, who is navigating a dark passage.

entities.name: wand
entities.description: An object that Harry uses to light his way and interact with the map.

entities.name: map
entities.description: A tool that Harry uses to navigate, which is affected by his magic.

entities.name: honeydukes
entities.description: A place that Harry thinks about to give him motivation and sustain him during his journey.

relationships.description: Harry uses his wand to light his way and interact with the map, as described in the text: 'He held up his wand, muttered, “Lumos!” and saw that he was in a very narrow, low, earthy passageway.'
Harry uses the map to navigate, as described in the text: 'He raised the map, tapped it with the tip of his wand, and muttered, “Mischief managed!” The map went blank at once.'
Harry is motivated by the thought of Honeydukes, as described in the text: 'It took ages, but Harry had the thought of Honeydukes to sustain him.'
